tutorial.intro:
Welcome to Work Clocker, the easiet tool to help you not working more than you have to.

Before you begin would you like to go through the tutorial?
tutorial.clockBtn:
With this button you can control when you start and end your work day.

Here you'll see a timer of the time you've worked already (including lunch hour).
tutorial.hours:
Here you'll see the number of extra hours that you worked or the hours you didn't work.

These are calcualted automatically when you clock out.
tutorial.menu: On the top right corner you'll find the menu. From here you can access the settings and the lists of clocked and spent hours.
tutorial.clockedHours:
Here you can see a listing of your daily hours.

Each item shows when you clocked in and out, how long you worked and how long was your lunch hour.
tutorial.spentHours:
Here you can see extra hours that you used to compensate days where you worked too little.

These are calculated automatically.
tutorial.settings:
Here you can find the application settings and other informational stuff.

Things like work day duration (used to calculate extra and owed hours), application language, terms of service, etc.

intro.hoursToggle: I have a pool of hours
intro.hoursText:
Some people have a yearly or month pool of justifiable hours

This pool can be used to get in later or leave earlier without any penalty

If you have a pool, Work Clocker uses the pool to calculate the owed hours
